image.altText: Man sits in wheelchair and smiles with hands put together

props.synopsis: Now a professional wheelchair basketballer, Tom O'Neill-Thorne can draw a direct link between his rise through the game and the night he watched the opening ceremony of the Sydney Paralympics more than 20 years ago.

title.children: How one moment of the 2000 Sydney Paralympics Games changed Tom's life

image.altText: Two images put together, left side Richard in work uniform, right side Richard in a hospital gown.

props.synopsis: Pathologist Richard Scolyer's colleagues have designed a high-stakes experiment to fight his brain tumour, using the very treatment they pioneered for melanoma.

title.children: Faced with 'certain death', pathologist Richard Scolyer is having an experimental treatment

image.altText: Roofs of new homes at a new housing estate.

props.synopsis: Australian property values are expected to stabilise as more homes come up for sale and buyers remain wary of high borrowing costs. Here's how your capital city fared in November.

title.children: Australia's median property price is now at a record high. Here's what's happening in your capital city

image.altText: Man on the phone in an office in front of two desktop computer screens

props.synopsis: Australians are already losing work to AI, but the impact so far has been largely hidden from view. But not to people like Benjamin, whose job was replaced by a chatbot.

title.children: 'We all got AI-ed': The Australian jobs being lost to AI under the radar

image.altText: School students

props.synopsis: Strengthened sexual consent education is now part of the Australian curriculum for all schools, and while non-government schools have some discretion in its implementation, the head of Catholic Education Tasmania has criticised the way consent is included in the national curriculum.

title.children: 'Amoral': Catholic education head takes issue with national sexual consent curriculum

image.altText: The helm of a USS warship looking out into the Mediterranean Sea

props.synopsis: Yemen's Houthi movement says its navy attacked two Israeli ships after they ignored unspecified warnings, with reports a US warship was also attacked.

title.children: Pentagon aware of reports US warship attacked in Red Sea by Houthi rebels

image.altText: Smoke rises over buildings in the Gaza strip, as seen from Israel

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says its ground offensive has expanded to every part of Gaza as authorities order more evacuations in the crowded south. Follow live.

title.children: Israel expands offensive to Gaza's south, says efforts will be 'no less strength' than in north

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: US warship reportedly attacked in Red Sea by Yemen's Houthi group
ICC prosecutor says Israel must respect international law
Israel expands ground offensive to southern Gaza

image.altText: A man stands in camouflaged gear looking at a burnt out building.

props.synopsis: Ukraine launches an inquiry into the alleged execution of two soldiers at the hands of their Russian counterparts.

title.children: Ukraine claims surrendering soldiers were 'executed' by Russian troops

image.altText: Couple in wedding outfits stands in the doorway

props.synopsis: An 'out-of-body experience' set Max Simensen on a course to changing his life and living authentically. He shares what he has learnt along the way.

title.children: Bathroom rules, new handshakes and a privilege paradox: what Max has learnt as a trans man

image.altText: Gold Coast Mayor Tom Tate speaks to the media

props.synopsis: Gold Coast Mayor Tom Tate confirms the city will be pulling out of the running to host the games.

title.children: Gold Coast mayor scraps bid to host 2026 Commonwealth Games

image.altText: Dozens of Chinese ships chase Philippine coast guard

props.synopsis: The Philippines Coast Guard says the maritime vessels were "scattered" within Whitsun Reef, about 320 kilometres west of Palawan Island and more than 1,000 kilometres from China's Hainan Island.

title.children: Philippines coast guard says presence of more than 135 Chinese maritime vessels is 'alarming'

image.altText: Wire on top of a wire fence as the sun sets behind it

props.synopsis: Serious violent and sexual offenders released following last month's landmark High Court ruling on indefinite detention could soon be behind bars again under proposed laws to expand Australia's preventative detention regime.

title.children: 'Serious offenders' recently released by High Court could be locked up again under proposed law

image.altText: 7-Eleven store

props.synopsis: The franchising industry has been besieged by numerous scandals and many reviews in recent years, but little has changed. Now a new government review could be a watershed moment — so long as it gets it right, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: Suicides, bankruptcies, marriage breakdowns: Could this be a watershed moment for Australia's scandal-prone franchising industry?

image.altText: a red ute driving past a reduce speed sign

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police say a 15-year-old boy has died and two other teenagers have been injured in a single-vehicle car crash about 30 kilometres south of Darwin.

title.children: Boy, 15, dies in car crash on Stuart Highway, south of Darwin

image.altText: A bottle shop worker leaning against a wall next to a poster promoting Jack Daniels.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government is describing itself as "dynamic and agile" for its snap decision to tighten liquor laws. Others say NT Labor's only taking action to win an election, writes Matt Garrick.

title.children: Booze law backlash in Top End as NT government accused of turning police into 'political pawns'

image.altText: A young women with blonde hair and a pink tshirt smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Belle Grati sought help after a sexual assault and her mother's death. Those two traumas would later see her denied coverage for life insurance.

title.children: 'Out of step with expectations': The rules allowing insurers to discriminate on mental health grounds

image.altText: A person pouring coffee and milk into a white coffee cup to make latte art.

props.synopsis: Oat lattes and soy flat whites have been a staple of inner-city cafe culture for years now — and the popularity is spreading to the country.

title.children: Plant-based milks are becoming a cafe staple — and not just in the city

image.altText: A farmer in a blue shirt and shorts cuddles a cow around its head

props.synopsis: Do you know where your milk comes from? If you're in Queensland there's half a chance it's travelled through NSW and Victoria, possibly from a dairy up to 2,000 kilometres away.

title.children: The 'soul-destroying' situation behind Australia's shrinking dairy industry

image.altText: Anna Hennessy and Aiden Marks

props.synopsis: Busting myths and stereotypes about Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) is important as it helps people to avoid making assumptions, write Anna Hennessy and Aiden Marks.

title.children: 'You don't look autistic': The reality of Autism Spectrum Disorder

image.altText: Simon Mallender portrait 2023-11-16 11:11:00

props.synopsis: Simon Mallender is determined not to let a single piece of recyclable soft plastic he has used make it into landfill.

title.children: Simon stores all his soft plastics at home, still waiting for a solution 12 months after REDcycle program collapse

image.altText: Yellow police van in front Eiffel Tower in the distance.

props.synopsis: The previously convicted 25-year-old attacker went after a German couple with a knife, killing the man, and then used a hammer to injure two others.

title.children: Paris attack near Eiffel Tower leaves tourist dead, two injured

image.altText: Police stand in a gymnasium covered in light debris

props.synopsis: Islamic State militants claim responsibility for a bomb attack on a Catholic mass at a university in southern Philippines that killed at least four people and injured 50 others.

title.children: Islamic State claims responsibility for deadly bomb attack on Catholic mass in Philippines

image.altText: palestinian men and boys stand on a heap of rubble looking for survivors

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says it has expanded its ground offensive to "every part" of the Gaza strip, as civilians crowd into an ever-shrinking area in the south of the enclave.

title.children: Civilians flee to south in search of safety as 'every part' of Gaza strip comes under attack

image.altText: Primary school kids in front of the Muttaburra state school sign

props.synopsis: Residents want a daily bus service to Longreach, 120 kilometres away, to give their children access to an affordable education in the outback.

title.children: Could a school bus help keep this town of 80-odd people alive? These residents think so

image.altText: Still from Bluey episode The Sign showing three cartoon dogs in a backyard playing on a swing.

props.synopsis: Fans will be able to visit a life-sized recreation of Bluey's family home.

title.children: 'Like being in a Bluey episode': Bluey's World set to open in Queensland

image.altText: Adrian Schrinner resign

props.synopsis: Adrian Schrinner resigns immediately from the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games Intergovernmental Leaders' Forum, saying it is a "pointless talkfest", while accusing the Queensland government of "playing politics" to create a "dysfunctional farce".

title.children: 'Fix up the mess the government has created': Brisbane lord mayor quits Olympic forum

image.altText: Erling Haaland looks unhinged

props.synopsis: Tottenham upsets the Premier League form guide to earn a thrilling 3-3 draw with Manchester City, with a 90th-minute equaliser giving Spurs their first point in over a month.

title.children: Manchester City fume as Spurs secure stunning point after controversial finish

image.altText: man holding yabby

props.synopsis: A fourth-generation farmer says orders for yabbies are going gangbusters again this festive period, as people look for affordable seafood alternatives for Christmas lunch.

title.children: With Christmas just around the corner, these crustaceans are in high demand

image.altText: Catherine O'Hara played Macaulay Culkin's mother in the 1990 film Home Alone and its 1992 sequel.

props.synopsis: Culkin is joined at the ceremony by his goddaughter Paris Jackson, siblings Rory and Quinn Culkin and actor Seth Green among others.

title.children: 'I'm so proud of you': Home Alone stars Macaulay Culkin and Catherine O'Hara reunite at Walk of Fame ceremony
